channel.title: Idea about tutorials
channel.description: I'm pretty sure this is n the wrong section but I see no forum about suggestions so here i go: I think before a user can post a tutorial a moderator of some sort must look over it and "approve" it before it gets posted it will rid the tutorial section of questions and unwanted tutorials. Just an idea.

item.title: Idea about tutorials
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:27, topic:215739”][quote author=billygotshot link=topic=283566.msg2303452#msg2303452 date=1214726258]
The moderators do a good job for the first few days because they think if they lock all the topics then people will stop posting dumbfuck questions. Instead people don’t see this and continue to spam anyways.
[/quote]
Its actually because it gets really tiresome after a week or so. We need moar backup of the admins.[/quote]

And that aswell. My point still stands that the moparscapers don’t realize that they are the reason for tons of problems.

Read full topic

item.title: Idea about tutorials
item.dc:creator: @anarkia anarkia
item.description:
@anarkia wrote:

its funny how off-topic this thread came to- the point of the thread was to make an approved tutorial board on mscp where when a moderator sees a tutorial that they think is worth for other members to read then they move it to the board to seperate the good tuts from the bad

Read full topic

item.title: Idea about tutorials
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

I just had to triple take the address bar to make sure I wasn’t at the wrong forums.
srsly.

I don’t think I’ve ever seen so many posters from moparscape scrap in consecutive posts without some form of consequence, let alone in any single thread itself.

Don’t feel too exalted from their praise; they are just trying overly hard to be accepted by a group of mods that will inevitably be slapping them shitless with a banhammer. Or attempting to slap around the hammer of said moderators, for that matter.

Read full topic

item.title: Idea about tutorials
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:8, topic:215739”]We don’t need a good quantity of moderators, what we need is good quality moderators.
You know what happens when they make new moderators? They do a good job for the first few days, and then they start moderating less and less. I’m sure others have noticed this too.[/quote]
We’re doing our best, you guys can always help by reporting topics.

I think the staff is currently fine now, apart from one person who needs to be in.

As well, I do my best to get on.
My football workouts are increasing, so I am less active in the morning and afternoon, and most of the day I play cod4 or am busy with my social life… I try to get on as much as I can, still to solve reports and respond to messages/posts.

Read full topic
